alert.note: Alert for Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Webster; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 7:43PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Heavy rain impacting portions of southwestern Randolph, west central Pocahontas, southeastern Nicholas and southern Webster Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 742 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of heavy rain, moving northeast at 5 mph. 1 to 2 inches of rain have already fallen over this area since early this morning. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Rising creeks and streams may cause high water along adjacent roads and low-lying areas. Locations impacted include... Richwood, Webster Springs, Addison (Webster Springs), Camden-On-gauley, Camden On Gauley, Craigsville, Cowen, Slaty Fork, Upper Glade, Bergoo, Nettie and Waneta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground.
